fields.name: ontology
fields.narrative_structure_details:
Narrative: The narrative is the backbone of the story. It includes the overarching story, time period, and cultural context. It sets the stage for events and characters' actions within the story and the environment where the story unfolds.

Character:  Characters are the agents driving the story, characterized by attributes including name, age, trait, skills, and inventory. Their relationships and roles within the narrative are meticulously defined, reflecting their interactions with each other and the story world. They participate in events, make choices that influence the narrative's direction, interact with objects, and engage in dialogues, all of which are instrumental in shaping the story's progression.

Event: Events are narrative milestones or actions that advance the plot. Defined by their titles and descriptions, events unfold within specific locations and may involve interactions with various objects. Events also incorporate dialogues, serving as the medium through which characters express themselves, make decisions, and engage with others. Events trigger choices for characters that can lead to another event or an ending, thereby guiding the narrative along varied paths.



Choice: Choices offer decision points to the reader, granting the ability to determine the story's outcome. Emerging from events and dialogues, choices lead characters to other events or an ending, thereby impacting the direction of the story.


Dialogue: Dialogues, inspired by characters' characteristics, are exchanges that contribute to plot progression through choices. These conversational elements add depth and dynamism to character interactions within the narrative.


Location: Locations are the settings within the story where events occur and characters interact. Detailed with descriptions, they enrich the narrative's backdrop. Each location contains one or more interactive objects that characters can engage with, adding layers of interactivity and complexity to the story.

Interactive Object: Interactive Objects are items within the narrative world that characters can engage with to influence the story's progression. They can be essential in events, acting as keys to unlock new narrative arcs or as tools to resolve challenges.

fields.name: BACKGROUND_STORY_REFINEMENT_PROMPT
INTERACTIVE_NARRATIVE_GENERATION_PROMPT
INTERACTIVE_NARRATIVE_REFINEMENT_PROMPT
fields.content:
As the reviser of text-based interactive fiction, your task is to revise an interactive narrative based on specific feedback from the author. You will receive the current narrative in JSON format and the author's feedback, which must be used to make precise adjustments to the narrative. It is essential to apply the feedback meticulously, ensuring that parts of the narrative not mentioned in the feedback remain unchanged.

Input:
Interactive Narrative: {interactive_narrative}
Author Feedback: {author_feedback}

Task:
Carefully revise the provided interactive narrative by incorporating the author's feedback. Your modifications should be targeted, affecting only the parts of the narrative directly mentioned in the feedback. The format and structure of the interactive narrative must remain intact, and the story elements not referenced in the feedback should not be modified. Ensure that the revised narrative remains coherent and consistent with the original narrative elements that were retained.

Output:
Provide the updated JSON file with the narrative revised according to the author's feedback. This revised JSON file will reflect the changes requested by the author and serve as the updated version of the interactive narrative for further development in the interactive fiction authoring process. Ensure the JSON starts and ends with curly brackets, with no extra text before or after.

fields.name: TWINE_CONFIGURATION_GENERATION_PROMPT
fields.content:
As a developer of text-based interactive fiction, your task is to convert the provided interactive narrative and author input into a Twine configuration. This configuration should outline the passages and links necessary for constructing the story in Twine, a tool for telling interactive, nonlinear stories.

Input:
Interactive Narrative: {interactive_narrative}
Author Input: {author_input}

Task:
Generate a Twine configuration that represents the interactive narrative. Your output will be a text-based representation of Twine passages and links, structured to reflect the flow and connections of the story as defined by the interactive narrative and author input. Each passage should encapsulate a portion of the narrative, with links that guide the reader to the next appropriate section based on their choices.

Output:
Produce a Twine configuration that clearly delineates each passage and its connections to others within the narrative framework. The configuration should include only the passages and links, formatted in a way that can be directly copied and pasted into Twine. Provide this as a plain text output, focusing solely on the passage titles and the links between them, without any additional text before or after.

fields.name: INTERACTIVE_NARRATIVE_COHERENCE_ANALYSIS_PROMPT
fields.content:
As the quality auditor of a text-based interactive fiction narrative, your task is to conduct a thorough review of the provided interactive narrative. Evaluate the coherence, consistency, and narrative flow, ensuring alignment with the narrative structure details.

Input:
Interactive Narrative: {interactive_narrative}
Narrative Structure Details: {narrative_structure_details}
Coherence Analysis Output Structure: {coherence_analysis_output_structure}

Task:
Analyze the interactive narrative to determine if it maintains logical consistency and coherence throughout the story.

Assess how well the narrative integrates the characters, events, locations, and interactive objects, following the narrative structure details.
Identify any discrepancies, inconsistencies, or areas where the narrative deviates from the author's specified requirements.

Provide suggestions for improvement, focusing on how to enhance narrative flow, character development, and event sequencing to better align with the provided interactive narrative.

Your analysis and suggestions should be structured according to the provided coherence analysis output structure. 

Output:
Generate a detailed report that evaluates the narrative's coherence, lists identified issues, and offers constructive suggestions for narrative enhancement. The report should be a single JSON file, well-organized and structured according to the coherence analysis output structure, ensuring a comprehensive review of the interactive narrative.

fields.name: BACKGROUND_STORY_GENERATION_PROMPT
fields.content:
As the narrator of text-based interactive fiction, your task is to create a background story that forms the foundation of an engaging interactive narrative. Use the author’s input to guide you in creating a background story that includes the following elements:

Author Input:
Genre: {genre}
Title: {title}
Initial Story Outline: {initial_story_outline}
Character Profiles: {character_profiles}

Task:
Create a background story incorporating the above elements, focusing on:
Narrative: Detail the overarching theme and setting of the story, the time period, cultural context, and the environment where the story unfolds. Include motivational hooks or mysteries that serve as engaging starting points for interaction.
Characters: Develop character profiles, including names, ages, traits, and backgrounds. Consider how these characters are initially positioned in relation to the motivational hooks or mysteries.
Events: Outline the main sequence of events and potential subplots that connect to or expand upon the initial hooks.
Interactive Objects: Identify key objects that characters can interact with that are also linked to the narrative hooks, enhancing the story’s interactivity.
Locations: Define key places within the story world for exploration that are integral to unraveling the motivational hooks.


Output:
Format the output with ’Title:’ immediately followed by the provided title, and directly after, ’Background Story:’ followed by the single paragraph of the background story narrative. The narrative should have approximately {max_words_background_story} words, presented without additional line spaces between the title and the background story. Ensure the final story adheres strictly to the author’s input and does not deviate from the provided title or story elements.
